data.title: Cambodian canal megaproject in trouble
data.description: PHNOM PENH - At a ceremony in August, Cambodian Prime Minister Hun Manet knelt to receive blessings from monks as fireworks and balloons heralded the breaking of ground for a  canal  he hopes will transform his country’s economic fortunes.

data.title: BMA 'sorry' for cycle lane chaos
data.description: The Bangkok Metropolitan Administration (BMA) has issued an apology and reopened a lane to traffic in Soi Sukhumvit 39 a day after closing it for a bicycle lane.

data.title: MP seeks middle path in referendum majority row
data.description: A United Thai Nation (UTN) list-MP yesterday called for a middle path as the House-Senate committee on referendums met to thrash out its differences over the size of the majority required to pass a charter referendum.

data.title: Police cadet school admits sexual harassment
data.description: The Royal Police Cadet Academy (RPCA) has confirmed a media report that a first-year  police cadet  was  sexually harassed  by an instructor and the instructor’s friend.

data.title: Vietnam, Malaysia seek to smooth tensions in South China Sea
data.description: Vietnam and Malaysia agreed to elevate ties and explore closer cooperation to maintain peace in the South China Sea, after a complaint from Malaysia raised tensions over the contested waters.

data.title: Australian teen dies from tainted liquor in Laos
data.description: SYDNEY/BANGKOK - An Australian teenager died on Thursday after drinking alcohol contaminated with methanol in Laos, Thai police and Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said, the fourth foreign national now suspected to have died in the incident.

data.title: Less than half of Thailand’s drug addicts in rehab: health minister
data.description: The Public Health Ministry says that despite the change in legislation, a little over 200,000 drug addicts have sought treatment this year

data.description: The International Federation of Muaythai Associations (IFMA) has appointed former Football Association of Thailand (FAT) president Worawi Makudi as a member of its Advisory Council.

data.title: iCon probe turns sights on politician 'S'
data.description: The Department of Special Investigation (DSI) has tied financial transactions by executives of the scandal-hit  The iCon Group  to the mother of a politician, with a total value of 100 million baht.

data.description: Stephen Irvine put the blame squarely on his shoulders for not securing a ONE Championship contract last week, but “El Matador” has vowed to get the job done next time out.

data.title: Stadium eyed as gig venue
data.description: The Ministry of Tourism and Sports plans to turn the Supachalasai National Stadium on Rama I Road into a new concert venue.

data.title: DDC sounds alarm as Evali vaping disease detected
data.description: The first case of Evali disease found in Buri Ram is worrying the Department of Disease Control (DDC) which fears a growing number of cases which are linked to e-cigarettes.

data.title: Navy chief sending officers to JTC
data.description: The commander-in-chief of the Royal Thai Navy (RTN) is ready to send marine and legal officers to join the soon-to-be-set-up Joint Technical Committee (JTC) to negotiate with Cambodia to resolve the disputed maritime areas in the Gulf of Thailand.

data.title: Grenade blasts injure 3 at worker camp
data.description: SONGKHLA: A 9-year-old girl was among three people injured by two exploding grenades fired into the construction camp of a giant Guanyin statue in Thepha district of this southern province yesterday.

data.title: Duct-taped banana sells for $6.2 million
data.description: NEW YORK — Arguably the most famous artwork of the past decade has found a new buyer.  Comedian , a sculpture by the artist Maurizio Cattelan, consisting of a piece of duct tape and a banana stuck to a wall, has sold for US$6.2 million at Sotheby’s in New York after more than six minutes of fierce bidding. The buyer is China-born crypto entrepreneur and Justin Sun, the auction house confirmed.

data.title: Thunderstorm warning issued for South
data.description: The Meteorological Department has issued a warning for severe thunderstorms affecting the southern region, anticipating torrential rain, gusty winds and rough sea conditions from Thursday to Saturday.

data.title: Police chief orders probe into alleged molestation by lecturer
data.description: National police chief Pol Gen Kitrat Phanphet has ordered an investigation into allegations that a lecturer at the Police Cadet Academy and a police interrogator made a cadet intoxicated and molested him at the academy.

data.title: 1,000 Days of resilience: Ukraine’s struggle amid Russian invasion

data.title: Govt to tackle THB1.31 trillion NPLs of households, SMEs

data.title: Unicef Myanmar appeals for $208 million to aid conflict-affected children
data.description: Unicef  Myanmar has launched an urgent appeal for US$208 million to support children affected by the escalating conflict in Myanmar.

data.title: Why are Yale students taking K-pop classes?
data.description: At Yale University, K-pop transcends global music fame to become a serious academic subject. At the recent two-day K-Pop: Musical Production and Consumption conference, 160 participants delved into the genre’s history, industry dynamics, and cultural influence.
